questions.question: How did German writers react to the Thirty Years' War, one of the causes of the Enlightenment?

choices.answer: They criticized the ideas of nationalism and warfare.
They wrote in support of nationalism and warfare.
They travelled from town to town to promote nationalism.

questions.question: What is the state of nature?

choices.answer: A state in which all people live in a utopian paradise.
What life might have been like before societies existed.
A state in which people lived under democratic rule.

imageMetadata.resources: Image credit: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File%3ATtitelblatt_1750_Leviathan_Thomas_Hobbs.jpg, See page for author [Public domain, mark 1.0], via Wikimedia Commons

questions.question: What is the social contractunder Thomas Hobbes?

choices.answer: People are born with natural rights.
People enter into a contract giving them rights at birth.
People gave up their freedom in exchange for order.

questions.question: What was the role of government according to John Locke?

choices.answer: To only protect the rights of the monarch.
To rule over its citizens with an iron fist.
To protect the nobles and aristocracy.
To protect natural rights, not take them away.

questions.question: Why does the Enlightenment come to be called the Age of Reason?

choices.answer: It's a time when people used reason to solve world problems.
It’s a time when people became more religious.
It’s a time when it was reasonable to be superstitious.

questions.question: Which two events were directly inspired by the writings of the philosophers & philosophes?

choices.answer: The Thirty Years’ War & The Crusades.
The French Revolution & Collapse of the Holy Roman Empire.
